name: Begum Khaleda Zia
designations: Former Prime Minister (First female PM of Bangladesh, three terms)

personalInfo.birthPlace: Jalpaiguri, Bengal Presidency, British India (now Dinajpur, Bangladesh)
personalInfo.spouse: Ziaur Rahman (m. 1960; died 1981) - Former President of Bangladesh

academicCareer.college: Surendranath College (Enrolled, did not complete degree)
academicCareer.degree: No formal degree (Self-educated is her description of her education)

timeline.event: Served as First Lady of Bangladesh during her husband Ziaur Rahman's presidency.
Led BNP to victory, becoming the first female Prime Minister of Bangladesh (140 seats from Dinajpur-3)
Instrumental in restoring the Parliamentary system via the 12th Amendment
Implemented major educational and economic reforms (e.g., compulsory primary education, VAT introduction)
Briefly served a second term before resigning to facilitate a caretaker government
Led BNP-led Four Party Alliance to a landslide victory, served as PM for a third term (193 seats)
Joined BNP as a general member after the assassination of Ziaur Rahman
Elected Chairperson of BNP
Led the pro-democracy movement against military dictator Hussain Muhammad Ershad (detained seven times)

electionConstituency: Feni-1, Bogura-6, Bogura-7, Dinajpur-3 (Elected/Contested multiple seats, a record for Bangladesh)

Nominate_details.Address_latest: Currently residing in Dhaka (released from detention on humanitarian grounds)
Nominate_details.Election_area_latest: Will contest the upcoming 2026 General Election from three constituencies (Confirmed Nov 2025)

overallSummary: Begum Khaleda Zia, born 15 August 1945, is the Chairperson of the BNP and a three-time former Prime Minister of Bangladesh (1991-1996, 1996, 2001-2006). Following her husband, President Ziaur Rahman's assassination in 1981, she entered politics and assumed leadership of the BNP in 1984. She is renowned for leading the anti-Ershad movement that restored democracy in 1990. Her premierships were marked by significant reforms in education and economics. After years of imprisonment on corruption charges, she was released on humanitarian grounds in 2020. Following the mass uprising in August 2024, she was fully released, and in early 2025, she was acquitted in the remaining corruption case, clearing her path to contest the upcoming 2026 general election from multiple constituencies.

professionalCareer.details: Entrepreneur in textile and agro-based industries (early career)

Organized grassroots conventions in Bogura, introducing secret ballots for local leadership selection
Appointed Senior Joint Secretary General
Elected Senior Vice Chairman at the 5th National Council
Assumed the role of Acting Chairman following his mother's imprisonment
Arrested during the Caretaker Government period and allegedly tortured
Left Bangladesh for London, UK, for medical treatment and has remained in exile since

electionConstituency: Bogura-6 (Contested in 2018 and recently nominated for 2025/2026 elections)
overallSummary: Tarique Rahman, born 20 November 1965, is the Acting Chairman of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) since February 2018. The eldest son of former President Ziaur Rahman and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, he began his political career at the grassroots level in Bogura in 1988. He rose through the party ranks, serving as Senior Joint Secretary General (2002) and Senior Vice Chairman (2009). He went into self-exile in London in 2008 for medical treatment following his arrest in 2007. Despite being abroad, he has been leading the party's movement for democracy. He is a controversial figure who has faced multiple convictions, including a 7-year sentence for money laundering (2016) and a life sentence for the 2004 Dhaka grenade attack (2018). He has been nominated by the BNP to contest upcoming elections from Bogura-6 and possibly other seats.

overallSummary: Salahuddin Ahmed, born 30 June 1962, is a senior Bangladeshi politician and a current Member of the BNP Standing Committee. A lawyer by profession, he left the BCS Administration Cadre in 1996 after serving as the Assistant Private Secretary to Prime Minister Khaleda Zia (1991–1996). He was elected MP from Cox's Bazar-1 for two consecutive terms (1996, 2001) and served as the State Minister for Communications from 2001-2006. In 2015, while serving as the party spokesperson, he was allegedly abducted and reappeared two months later in Shillong, India. He was charged with illegal entry but was ultimately acquitted by Indian courts in 2023. During his exile, he was appointed to the BNP Standing Committee. Following the political change in August 2024, he returned to Bangladesh after over nine years abroad and is actively involved in the party's current activities.

overallSummary: Dr. Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain, born 1 October 1946, is a highly educated and senior politician of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and a distinguished academic. Holding a PhD in Geology from the University of London, he was a Professor and Chairman of the Geology Department at the University of Dhaka before entering active politics. He joined the BNP in 1979 and has been a member of its Standing Committee since 1994. He was elected Member of Parliament for Cumilla-2 for four terms (1991-2006) and served in key ministerial roles, including Minister of Power, Energy and Mineral Resources (1991–95) and Minister of Health and Family Welfare (2001–06). He has a notable international profile, including serving as the Chairman of the 56th World Health Assembly.

overallSummary: Mirza Abbas Uddin Ahmed, born 7 February 1951, is a senior leader and Standing Committee member of the BNP. An accomplished businessman and founder of Dhaka Bank, he is one of the most prominent politicians from the capital city. His career highlights include serving as the Mayor of the undivided Dhaka City Corporation (1991-1993) and as the Minister of Housing and Public Works (2001-2006) in Khaleda Zia's cabinet. As Minister, he notably worked to amend building construction rules and formulate Private Housing Land Development Rules. Throughout his political life, he has faced numerous legal challenges and periods of incarceration, from which he was eventually freed in 2024 and acquitted in 2025. He remains a key decision-maker in the BNP and is expected to be a major candidate in the upcoming general election.

overallSummary: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan, born 1 January 1947, is a highly respected BNP politician and former academic. Holding a Ph.D. in Physics from the University of Sussex, he served as a Professor at the University of Dhaka before entering politics in 1991. He was elected Member of Parliament for Narsingdi-2 for four consecutive terms (1991-2006). During his ministerial career, he held key portfolios, including Minister of State for Planning and Minister for Science and ICT, often being cited for his moderate and intellectual approach to politics. Since 2009, he has been a core member of the BNP's National Standing Committee. He is a son of Abdul Momen Khan, a founder member and former Minister of the BNP. Dr. Moyeen Khan remains a key spokesperson and strategist for the party, advocating for democratic transition and accountability.

overallSummary: Ishraque Hossain, born 5 April 1987, is a young, UK-educated engineer and a dynamic politician in the BNP. He is the son of the revered late politician and former Dhaka Mayor, Sadeque Hossain Khoka, and has leveraged this legacy to quickly rise within the party. He notably contested the 2020 Dhaka South City Corporation mayoral election. In March 2025, the Election Tribunal controversially declared him the rightful winner of that election, although the term had expired. This legal victory further solidified his position as a key leader in the capital. He is currently a Member of the BNP's Central International Affairs Committee and has been nominated by the party to contest the upcoming general election from the Dhaka-6 constituency, which was historically represented by his father.

overallSummary: Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury, born 10 November 1949, is a prominent Bangladeshi politician, economist, and businessman, currently serving as a Member of the BNP National Standing Committee. Educated in Chattogram and London, he established himself as a key figure in the country's finance and commerce sectors, notably as the founder of the Chittagong Stock Exchange and a former two-term President of the Chittagong Chamber of Commerce. He was elected MP for Chittagong-8 on three occasions (1991, 1996, 2001) and served as Minister of Commerce (2001–2004) under Prime Minister Khaleda Zia. Known for his pro-reform stance and expertise in international trade, he remains one of the most visible and vocal leaders in the BNP, particularly concerning economic policy and the restoration of democratic order.

overallSummary: Professor Dr. A. Z. M. Zahid Hossain, born 25 December 1960, is a highly qualified physician, Urologist, and a pivotal leader in the BNP. A Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, Edinburgh, he was a Professor of Urology before dedicating himself to politics. He rose through the ranks of professional political organizations, serving as General Secretary of the Doctors Association of Bangladesh (DAB). Within the BNP, he was a Vice-Chairman before his promotion to the National Standing Committee in August 2024. He is most recognizable as the personal physician and official spokesperson for the health of Begum Khaleda Zia. Though his primary professional base is in Dhaka, he maintains strong political links to the Dinajpur-6 constituency, where he is actively engaged in party organization and is the expected nominee for the next general election.

Represented Pakistan National Football Team; was East Pakistan's fastest runner (100m and 200m) in 1964-1966.
Served as President of the Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF). Awarded FIFA Order of Merit.

professionalCareer.details: Author of several books on the Liberation War, military life, and democracy, including 'Rokte Bheja Ekattur' and 'Gonotantra Remande'.

Appointed to the BNP National Standing Committee.
Remains a vocal, senior leader, frequently participating in public rallies and discussions, particularly on issues concerning the Liberation War's spirit and national security.

Nominate_details.Election_area_latest: Bhola - 3 (His long-time representative constituency and likely nomination for the next election)

overallSummary: Major (Retd.) Hafiz Uddin Ahmed, Bir Bikrom (born 29 October 1944), is a distinguished Bangladeshi military veteran, politician, and national athlete. He was awarded the 'Bir Bikrom' gallantry award for his courageous role as a company commander during the 1971 Liberation War. After retiring as a Major from the Bangladesh Army, he entered politics, achieving a record six terms as the Member of Parliament for Bhola-3 (1986–2006). He served in multiple cabinet roles under Khaleda Zia, including Minister of Water Resources and Minister of Commerce. Beyond politics and military service, he was a celebrated athlete who represented Pakistan in football and served as the President of the Bangladesh Football Federation. As a member of the BNP National Standing Committee, he is one of the party's most respected senior figures, often serving as a key voice on national security, democracy, and political history.

overallSummary: Iqbal Hasan Mahmud Tuku, born in 1950, is a prominent veteran politician and a Member of the National Standing Committee of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP). He comes from an influential political family in Sirajganj, being the son of former Minister Abdullah al Mahmood. Tuku was elected Member of Parliament for Sirajganj-2 on three occasions (1986, 1988, and 2001). During the 2001-2006 BNP government, he held ministerial portfolios, serving as the State Minister of Power and later as State Minister of Agriculture. A vocal proponent of parliamentary democracy, he remains one of the most influential figures in the BNP's current strategy and has been nominated by the party to contest the next election from his stronghold, Sirajganj-2.

overallSummary: Babu Gayeshwar Chandra Roy, born 1 November 1951, is a central, influential figure and Standing Committee Member of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP). Beginning his political career in the JSD, he joined the BNP's youth wing, Jubo Dal, in 1978, eventually serving as its General Secretary for 15 years. His prominence led him to be appointed as the State Minister for Environment and Forest (1991–1993) under the technocrat quota. Known for his fiery rhetoric and unwavering loyalty to Begum Khaleda Zia, he is a primary voice of the party and one of the highest-ranking Hindu leaders in the BNP. He has consistently contested the Dhaka-3 (Keraniganj) constituency and remains a key leader in the party's push for electoral and democratic reforms following the recent political changes. In 2025, he was acquitted in a long-running graft case, clearing his legal status for the next general election.

Nominate_details.Election_area_latest: Patuakhali - 1 (His representative constituency and confirmed nominee for the next election)

overallSummary: Air Vice Marshal (Retd.) Altaf Hossain Chowdhury (born c. 1943) is a highly prominent leader of the BNP and a decorated military veteran, having served as the 8th Chief of Air Staff of the Bangladesh Air Force (1991–1995). Following his retirement in 1995, he joined the BNP and quickly rose to power, winning the Patuakhali-1 seat in 2001. During the 2001-2006 government, he held the influential cabinet positions of Minister of Home Affairs and Minister of Commerce. Despite facing numerous legal and political challenges, he remains a Vice-Chairman of the BNP and the President of the Patuakhali District unit. He is an active and vocal politician, currently focusing on party unity and preparation for the upcoming national election in his home constituency.

name: Advocate Harunur Rashid

portfolio.latest: Member of the Jatiya Sangsad for Chapainawabganj-3 (2019-2022) [Resigned]
previous: President/General Secretary, Chapainawabganj District BNP (Past role)

personalInfo.spouse: Syeda Asifa Ashrafi Papia (Also a prominent BNP politician)

timeline.event: Elected Member of Parliament (MP) from Chapainawabganj-3 (7th Jatiya Sangsad).
Re-elected MP from Chapainawabganj-3 (8th Jatiya Sangsad).
Elected MP from Chapainawabganj-3 (11th Jatiya Sangsad) as a BNP candidate.
Resigned from the Parliament along with other BNP MPs as part of the party's movement.
Faced charges related to tax evasion on a luxurious imported car.
A Dhaka court sentenced him to five years in prison for the tax evasion case (later granted bail by the High Court).
Actively involved in the party's movement and advocacy, serving as a key voice for the BNP from the Rajshahi/North Bengal region.

Nominate_details.Election_area_latest: Chapainawabganj - 3 (His primary constituency and confirmed nominee for the next election)

overallSummary: Advocate Harunur Rashid, born 1 January 1962, is a successful lawyer and a prominent Member of the BNP National Executive Committee. He is a multi-term former Member of Parliament for the Chapainawabganj-3 constituency, having served in the 7th, 8th, and 11th Jatiya Sangsads. He is one of the four BNP MPs who took the oath of office after the disputed 2018 election, but he ultimately resigned in late 2022 in line with the party's policy. Although he faced legal challenges related to tax evasion, he remains a key political force in the North Bengal region and is the strong nominee for the Chapainawabganj-3 seat in the upcoming general election.

name: Barkat Ullah Bulu

previous: Member of Parliament for Noakhali-2 (1991–2001 - Three terms: 5th, 6th, and 7th Parliaments)
President/General Secretary, Jatiyatabadi Jubo Dal (BNP's youth wing)

designations: Multi-term former Member of Parliament (Noakhali-2 and Noakhali-3)
Key leader of BNP in the Greater Noakhali region

personalInfo.spouse: Shamima Akter Lucky (Former Cultural Secretary, JCD, Dhaka University)
children: Two Sons (One named Sharif Md Imran Saniat)

academicCareer.degree: Graduate with a Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) degree (1980)

professionalCareer.details: A career politician who has also been involved in business.

timeline.event: Was active in Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) and later served as the central President/General Secretary of Jatiyatabadi Jubo Dal (BNP's youth wing).
Elected MP from Noakhali-2 (5th, 6th, and 7th Parliaments).
Served as State Minister of Commerce.
Elected MP from Noakhali-3 (9th Parliament).
Held the central party positions of Joint Secretary General and currently serves as Vice-Chairman.
Faced numerous cases, including those related to illegal wealth accumulation and political violence.
Acquitted by a Dhaka court in a major graft case filed by the ACC, clearing his legal standing.

electionConstituency: Noakhali - 3 (Begumganj Upazila and parts of other Upazilas)

Nominate_details.Election_area_latest: Noakhali - 3 or Noakhali - 2 (Expected to contest one of his former constituencies in the next election)

overallSummary: Barkat Ullah Bulu, born 20 December 1956, is a veteran politician and current Vice-Chairman of the BNP. He began his political career through the party's student and youth wings, eventually serving as the central leader of Jatiyatabadi Jubo Dal. He has represented the Noakhali region in the Jatiya Sangsad multiple times, winning from Noakhali-2 in the 1990s and Noakhali-3 in 2008. During the 2001-2006 BNP government, he served as the State Minister of Commerce. Known for his strong organizational base in Greater Noakhali, he is a key figure in the party's central command. Despite facing numerous political and legal challenges in the past decade, including a graft case from which he was acquitted in early 2025, he remains a vocal and active senior leader, focusing on party mobilization in preparation for the next general election.
